solution_line_template: The discount for the Delta flight would come to ${delta_flight_cost} * {delta_discount_percent} = $<<{delta_flight_cost}*{delta_discount_percent}={delta_discount_amount}>>{delta_discount_amount}.
The final price of the Delta flight would come to ${delta_flight_cost} - ${delta_discount_amount} = $<<{delta_flight_cost}-{delta_discount_amount}={delta_final_price}>>{delta_final_price}.

The discount of the United flight would come to ${united_flight_cost} * {united_discount_percent} = $<<{united_flight_cost}*{united_discount_percent}={united_discount_amount}>>{united_discount_amount}.
The final price of the United flight would come to ${united_flight_cost} - ${united_discount_amount} = $<<{united_flight_cost}-{united_discount_amount}={united_final_price}>>{united_final_price}.
The Delta flight would be cheaper than the United flight by ${united_final_price} - ${delta_final_price} = $<<{united_final_price}-{delta_final_price}={money_saved}>>{money_saved}.
